comments.commentBody:
As ugly as I thought the "republicans" were or could be, has been dramatically eclipsed, by the vulgarity that is.

What an embarrassment for our country.
Talk about "the ugly American"

The Great Depression gave FDR the conditions to enable Social Security, Worker Rights and Unemployment Insurance to become a reality. If Trump "enables" the Democrats with filibuster-proof majorities in the Congress, they must treat it as a great chance for long-sought and long-needed projects like single payer national health care and income tax reforms that are truly progressive.
I heard, many people are saying, that Hillary is sending money to Donald so he can continue his meltdown. It's what people say...

Nominee Trump is a demagogue--one to be classed with the likes of Louisiana's Gov. Huey Long.

It is ironic that the demagogic Trump has now turned on the demagogic party that spawned him--and that party leaders are waiting for further polls before deciding how to pay him back in kind.

Perhaps, however, it is time to turn away from our fixation on an individual demagogue and focus on the far graver threat: the institutionalized demagoguery of the GOP itself.

Demagoguery effectively shuts down rational discourse and reflective consideration of alternative solutions to our many problems.

Isn't that what the Grand Obstructionist Party is all about?

Among the GOP's demagogic strategies are appeals to divisive "social/moral" issues, identification with a shallow militaristic "patriotism" and a
narrow Christian fundamentalism, obstructionist Hastert rules and Norquist pledges, etc.

While pursuing these strategies, many GOP politicians and spokespersons--not just candidate Donald Trump--employ the demagogue's favored techniques on a daily basis: gross oversimplification, fear mongering, scapegoating, emotional appeals, accusations that opponents are disloyal or weak, attacks on the news media, obstructive refusals of all compromise--and, yes, bald faced lies.

Donald Trump's candidacy is the symptom, not the disease.

The voters can readily reject this individual buffoonish demagogue.

But just who will reform this cadaverous Republican Party?

It looks like both parties' pollsters seem aligned on the direction of the race, though they await a new round of polling to see where to allocate resources. Trump retains the support of his base but is losing soft supporters and independents while Hillary Clinton continues to gain among millennials, white females without college degrees and will likely have the largest margin among latino voters that we've ever seen. The gap between the Democratic and Republican nominees among white voters is the lowest it has been since Bill Clinton won re-election in 1996. It stands to reason that Hillary Clinton will have a margin of victory that aligns to the results in 2008 or 1996.

"Outside a ski shop on Tuesday in Aurora, Colo., Sharon and Les Sparks said they were disappointed by Republicans pulling away from Mr. Trump, whom Mr. Sparks described as 'spoiled little entitled brats.'"

Wow. I disagree with John McCain on almost every issue, yet it had never even occurred to me to include a man who spent over 5 years in the Hanoi Hilton for his country among "spoiled little entitled brats."

Between the Sparks and Trump, maybe all this "honor our veterans, support our troops" rhetoric Republicans claim to believe in is just a show.
True but he is "foul mouthed" you forgot that part!

No matter what vile thoughts any republican voter might harbor about Hillary Clinton, you must at least admit that she is stable and sane. Trump has not just shown himself to be a tad off kilter, he is a full blown basket case of a human being. Donald J Trump has clearly demonstrated that the needs of his ego supersedes those of all other causes. They rise above country, party and even family. If you think Mr. Trump cares one iota about you, your kids or your community, I assure you that he absolutely doesn't. Trump only cares about how much your applause sends a quick shot of energy though his decrepit and damaged psyche. You are not a person to him, only a drug. Republican nominee Donald J. Trump has revealed himself to be a very damaged man. You put him there republican voters, it is now up to you to end all of this madness and move on.

Unfortunately, some of the otherwise moderate thinking conservatives I know, and in this case a women, still maintain that Trump is the less of two evils. As I was informed yesterday, HRC has "blood on her hands".  This person offered up no specific details; I can only assume we are talking about a) Vince Foster, b) Benghazi, or c) one of the many insiders who has suddenly died in order to maintain the Clinton's vault of secrets (again, no specific names, just some some people died).  Clear evidence of Trump's attitudes and behaviors over 30+ years are no substitute for gut feelings and hunches nurtured by HRC's fake smile, practiced (aka knowledgable) words, or unflattering pantsuits.

What is happening now is reminiscent of when McGovern became the Dem nominee fueled by the more liberal elements of the party, and lost in a landslide to Nixon. Now, Trump was picked by the more radical elements of the Republican Party, and we may see a landslide on the other side. It couldn't happen to better bunch of hypocrites! One can only hope that it allows the Republican stranglehold in Congress to finally be broken.
Not the popcorn,the Champaign!!!!! Oh yes!!
GOP's implosion = Karma

What a mess the USA political system is with first past the post. You need to move with the times and change your political system to MMP (Mixed Member Proportional representation) like New Zealand has.

@CK

The entire population of New Zealand would fit in a a med-size city in a small state. There are 330 million of us. Proportional representation would be madness.

Even with MMPR there's still only one president and he or she would be from one of the 2 largest parties. No different than what we have now.

We also have 50 states each with its own government and each state runs its own elections, even for President. The US Constitution describes in detail how the US Government is to be composed and conducted and is difficult to amend.

Individual states could have proportionate representation within the state government and states do have the option of awarding their electors for President proportionately. But understandably no state wants to do it because it would put the winner in that state at a disadvantage. It would only work if it were a Federal law and applied to all states.

If the Republican National Committee prepared an autopsy report in 2012 after loosing the presidential elections, this time it may have to prepare not only another autopsy report, but psychoanalises reports on many of the leaders of the party. What a mess they have done to the party of Lincoln, Teddy Roosevelt, Eisenhower and Reagan!

The 2016 autopsy is already in:

Subject appears to have died following removal of its heart, brains and guts. Additionally, subject appears to have repeatedly shot itself in one foot while sticking the other one in its mouth.

I can't stand this fallacy that the modern day Republican party is the party of Lincoln. When Lincoln was president, the DEMOCRATIC SOUTH left the Union. The demographics of both major parties has completely flipped from the time of Abraham Lincoln. We're in a new party system already, and hopefully on the verge of yet another.
Psst: The mess started with Reagan!
I have the great fortune of witnessing the behavior of Mainland tourists on a daily basis. If anything, this article severely under calls the horrible behavior on display from 95% of them.

Its high time martini-swilling establishment republicans finally banded together against the Tea Party republicans. All they lack is an appropriately evocative moniker.

Cocktail Party Republicans, anyone?
You must feel so virtuous.
Start by fixing the education system that has produced so many ignorant people that would vote for Trump!  A long process, but likely the best way to get your nation up a level.
You can dissolve the party, but you can't dissolve the people or the ideas. Donald Trump wouldn't have gotten this far if there hadn't been a lot of people who were sold on what he had to sell.
Shameful

The blind hatred and rationalizations of Trump supporters is sobering, maybe even breathtaking, as if they feel no responsibility to their countrymen or generations to come, and no sense of stewardship of what they themselves were given.

This isn't the damned WWE. This absurd tribalism, fed and nurtured over a generation+ by a cynical strategy now out of control, is the greatest threat the US has faced in this lifetime, magnitudes more an existential threat to our Republic than terrorism.

Very well said. I totally agree, the vitriol and spite of the highly toxic Ailes-Limbaugh axis has turned millions of people into scared-angry consumers of conspiracy theories who have been ripe for the picking by a fascist like Trump.

A serious question must be raised: Is Trump going to take his band of zealots into outright seditious territory? As a sociopath, he has absolutely no qualms about the greater good... He's really a terrorist threat from within.

I predict he will go down the seditious road, along with his followers.  He is setting the stage.  I think it could get pretty violent but it also could be such that it knocks some sense into both the American public and some of our pathetic decision makers who allowed this to happen.  As much as I think both Ryan and McConnell are jerks, I suspect they each have some insight into how their own choices lead to this very sad mess.  They want a steady ship as it is the only means by which they can benefit.  Either way, I don't think it will be pretty.

If you are in a non-swing state, or a reliably red state, vote Green. If they garner 5% of total ballots, they will qualify for funding in 2020. The US needs a viable third party as a check on the 2 dominant parties.
If the GOP self destructs is it possible to resurrect it into a social democrat party like they have in Europe??

Good! Can you imagine how much good could have accrued to humanity if the National Socialist Party had not received the single largest number of votes (33%) in the German elections of 1933?

Vote Democratic all the way in November!

Here we go.  When his poll numbers (and perhaps those down ballot) reach a "critical low point", Trump's next move is to call for a boycott of the election, claiming "rigged", and moving to secure a post-election role...at best, as a voice from the fringe constantly bullying from the sideline and at worst as the catalyst for significant mayhem in our democratic (small d) house built on a foundation of a larger social contract.  It will test our mettle.

Some will cut their nose to spite their face. Of course  what media hypocrisy  caused your vote. Actual Don Trump quotes; studies regarding his many policies; actual value opinion polls. This sounds more like a GOP lament that the experts are bogus and Trump's high-school drop audience knows the real economic, military and social policies to improve US living conditions.

If you want to see what life is like with a Republican Party too small and weak to block Democratic initiatives, just have a look at my state, California. We'd tried the celebrity thing: he had such confidence and charm, such simple answers to all our problems. Having gotten that out of our system, we brought back the boring, aging technocrat (now more crat than tech). He won the people's trust, and made them see that (due to our super-majority requirements for passing tax law) nothing could be accomplished until the obstructive Republicans were reduced to a super-minority. Once that was accomplished, he restrained the hotter heads among the victorious Democrats, turning them from politics and revenge to the boring business of governing. We've still got a long way to go, but we're headed in the right direction, something few other states can say. And just 6 years ago, we were deep in a hole and digging hard. It gets better.
